title: Man arrested in deadly Olivehurst drive-by shooting
content:
YUBA COUNTY, CA - The Yuba County Sheriff's Department reports they have arrested a man in connection with a drive-by shooting last Sunday evening that left one man dead and three others injured.
Undersheriff Jerry Read said Kong Meng Vue, 25, of Marysville, wastaken into custody as heleft a home in Linda late Wednesday morning. The Yuba Sutter Gang Task Force assisted in the arrest.
The shooting was on the 5800 block of Poplar Avenue at approximately 10 p.m. Sunday night. The shots came from a dark-colored car and struck people inside a home. Killed was Teng Yang, 20, of Olivehurst. Three others were hurt and transported to an area hospital with non-life-threatening injuries, said Read at the time.
The sheriff's department continues to investigate the shooting.
